abstract.p: World Trade Organization affirms that Brazil erred in failing to end illegal subsidies to its aircraft industry; Canadian-owned Bombardier argued that it was hurt by subsidized Brazilian manufacturer Embraer (S)

block.p: The World Trade Organization affirmed that Brazil erred in failing to end illegal subsidies to its aircraft industry. Canada successfully argued that the subsidies to the regional jet maker Embraer hurt revenue at the Canadian-owned Bombardier in the flourishing market for small passenger planes. Last summer the trade organization ruled that each country's financial support for its aircraft makers violated global trade rules and set a deadline of November 1999 for compliance. Talks on a compromise failed. On Wednesday the trade body will rule on Canada's request for $3.3 billion in sanctions.
